name: merkle-proof-tutorial
description: Imagine having a vast collection of data, like a list of transactions in a blockchain or a database of users. To check if a specific item is in this massive dataset, you'd typically have to sift through the entire thing, which can be slow and inefficient. However, there's a clever solution called Merkle Proofs that can make this process efficient and secure. This proof is named after Ralph Merkle, who patented the concept in 1979.
